title: Workshop for Developing Elementary Math Spatial Perception and Problem-Solving Teaching Methods Using Immersive Web Environments (IWE): Strengthening Geometry, Measurement, and Algebra Domains

context.prior_knowledge: Theoretical knowledge of elementary mathematics education (geometry, measurement, algebra domains) and experience in designing lessons based on Bloom’s taxonomy. Possession of basic skills in using web-based tools and the ability to perform fundamental formula calculations and interpret graphs
context.additional_context: Requires optimization for low-technology environments to utilize smartphone-based IWE tools. Aims to enhance instructional design competencies for math concepts (formulas, graphs, statistics) aligned with Bloom's taxonomy levels. Needs to provide differentiated problem-solving activities (calculation, measurement, proof) by learner level. Strengthens evidence-based analysis through virtual manipulation tools.

learning_goals: Using IWE-based 3D geometric models and virtual manipulation tools, learners can improve spatial perception and geometric problem-solving abilities (formula application, measurement, proof) by 20%.
Design three IWE activities per math domain (equation solving, graph interpretation, statistical analysis) aligned with Bloom’s Taxonomy levels of "Understanding-Applying-Analyzing."
Select two low-spec IWE tools accessible via smartphone web browsers, establish a lesson integration plan, and incorporate them into calculation, measurement, and proof activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
